item.title: Assault Kill
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

I’m guessing you’re processing the Wilderness/Non-wilderness interfaces? If so, then remove it, or make it only do so when you’re in the Wilderness.

Read full topic

item.title: Assault Kill
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

You can draw the interface once you enter the area, and make the string update each time you kill the monster. Also you may want to stop processing those un-needed interfaces.

Read full topic

item.title: Assault Kill
item.dc:creator: @I_Uk_0wn4g3_I I Uk 0wn4g3 I
item.description:
@I_Uk_0wn4g3_I wrote:

public boolean InAssault() { if((absX >= 2576 && absX <= 2623 && absY >= 3145 && absY <=3179)) return true; else return false; }

public void Assault() { setInterfaceWalkable(4535); sendQuest("Assault Kill: "+assaultKills, 4536); }

if (InAssault()) { Assault(); }

It’s hard to explain and i couldnt video it because the video couldnt capture the Assault Kill. These are my codes for assault the killcount appears but it flashes it doesnt STICK, and is hard to see.

Read full topic
